content: rook scarf by sophia kessinger for this scarf you will need yarn 2 or more skeins of worsted to bulky self-striping yarn like noro kureyon or swtc karaoke 2 skeins will yield a short scarf 3-4 skeins will be needed for a more standard length scarf hook size k scarf width gauge is not crucial with this project using noro and following this pattern you will get a scarf width of approximately 7 when varying the scarf width make sure you are working across an odd number of stitches terms chain = chain st = stitch single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double crochet the pattern chain 20 loosely work a single_crochet in the back bump of each chain across 19sc s total work even row chain 1 work a single_crochet in each st across 19 single_crochet repeat the work even row until the color of your yarn has changed at the beginning of the next row it doesn t matter which side of the piece because it s reversible go to v row v row chain 1 *single_crochet in the next st double_crochet in the space 2 row below the next st* across ending the row with a single_crochet go back to work even row until the next color change then work another v row repeat until scarf is desired length v row illustration the toothpick is indicating the space into which you double_crochet it s 2 row down and a bit to the left insert hook into this space draw up a loop of yarn and continue to work a double_crochet as usual items made from pattern may not be used for resale pattern & images © 2008 sophia kessinger
